There was one other sighting in Kansas City on or around August 19th 2011
divs: sighting detailson august 19, 2011 @ approximately 9:30 pm, after attending the ethnic enrichment festival @ swope park in kansas city, missouri, we were sitting on a set of steps to the south of the festival. we were up a hill and far away (approximately 200 yards) from the lights that were being emitted from the festival. this was giving us a good view of kansas city toward the north. upon leaving the steps, in the north sky, we both saw a rather large "comet-like" object travelling eastward and horizontal to the horizon. at first, we both thought it was a meteor (albeit the best and largest one either one of us had ever seen). this changed when the object broke apart and a section decended 90 degrees vertical toward the horizon. like the first section, this second section also appeared to be on fire. this occurrence allowed us to believe that perhaps we had seen two aircraft collide. the second section travelled toward the ground\horizon at a faster rate that the section travelling eastward. when this second section reached what appeared to be a few hundred feet above the earth, it stopped and hovered. at that point, it did not change direction vertically or horizontally. it simply didn't move at all. the first section continued to travel toward the east. approximately one minute from the first part of the sighting, both objects immediately disappeared\vanished. we made our way back to the car in dismay to the fact that no one else appeared to have seen the same thing. with much excitement, we decided to get in the car and head north on us-71 highway toward the area in which the second object appeared to "hover". approximately 7 or 8 minutes after our first sighting, upon travelling northbound on the highway, we saw a very similar object to the first one we had seen travelling vertically toward the earth. it appeared to be on fire just as the first two only minutes before had appeared. a few thousand feet above the earth, it broke apart into five other "star-like" shapes and stopped. these star-like objects appeared to surround or rotate around the initial object. all objects at that point began to take an eastward route toward independence, missouri. we observed all of this second sighting while travelling northbound on us-71. this second sighting lasted approximately two to three minutes.
